intro: Euplassa bleasdalei, commonly known as the Bleasdale's euplassa, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,000 and 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
